greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer partitions of n with no part dividing all the others.
comment: Alternative name: Number of integer partitions of n that are empty or have smallest part not dividing all the others.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: a(n) = A000041(n) - Sum_{d|n} A000041(d-1) for n > 0. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Mar 25 2021
example: The a(5) = 1 through a(12) = 7 partitions (empty column indicated by dot):
mathematica: a /@ Range[0, 50] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 09 2021, after _Andrew Howroyd_ *)
program: (PARI) a(n)={numbpart(n) - if(n, sumdiv(n, d, numbpart(d-1)))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Mar 25 2021
xref: The Heinz numbers of these partitions are A342193.
The case with maximum part not divisible by all the others is A343342.
The case with maximum part divisible by all the others is A343344.
A000070 counts partitions with a selected part.
A001787 count normal multisets with a selected position.
A006128 counts partitions with a selected position.
A015723 counts strict partitions with a selected part.
A167865 counts strict chains of divisors > 1 summing to n.
Sequences with similar formulas: A024994, A047966, A047968, A168111.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 23 2021
